etomica.graphics

Class DecimalSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JSlider
            • etomica.graphics.DecimalSlider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class DecimalSlider
extends javax.swing.JSlider
    Slider that permits variation of decimal (non-integer) values. Extends the swing JSlider class (which permit input/output of integer values only) and overrides methods in which the user sets/gets current values, maximum and minimum values, etc., and scales the user value by a factor of to increase the apparent precision of the slider. Thus, if the user wants values in from 0 to 1 in increments of 0.01, this slider intercepts all communications with user and scales values by factor of 100, so that (unknown to user) slider is actually working with values from 0 to 100 in incremnts of 1. set/getPrecision method is used to specify the precision of the slider.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getPrecision

        public int getPrecision()
        Accessor method for precision of slider, defined as number of digits after the decimal that will be distinguished by slider. For example, if value is 3, then slider will give values in increments of 0.001. Precision = 0 means to work with integer values. Maximum allowable value is 16.

      • setPrecision

        public void setPrecision(int p)
        Mutator method for precision of slider. See getPrecision.
